meanings.definition: Inclined or willing to do something again
meanings.sent1: After enjoying the movie, she felt redisposed to watch it once more.
meanings.sent2: He was redisposed to help his friend with the project, showing his willingness to assist.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed redisposed to chase the laser pointer endlessly, finding it amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was redisposed to memories of childhood, like a book opening to familiar pages.
meanings.sent5: The old clock, redisposed to ticking after years of silence, filled the room with its rhythmic sound.

meanings.definition: Having a predisposition or tendency towards something
meanings.sent1: Being redisposed to allergies, she always carried her medication.
meanings.sent2: The artist was redisposed to painting landscapes, showcasing his natural inclination.
meanings.sent3: The dog, redisposed to stealing socks, had quite the collection hidden away.
meanings.sent4: His heart, redisposed to love, overflowed with affection for his family.
meanings.sent5: The tree, redisposed to growing towards the sunlight, stood tall and proud in the garden.
